intro: Chomelia albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed chomelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, white or pale green stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, red or orange fruits. Chomelia albicaulis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
